intro: Erigeron macranthus, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron macranthus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
